description: Days since the customer’s last failed login attempt, indicating potential unauthorized access attempts.
Count of card transactions in specific merchant category codes over the last 7 days.
Count of customer point-of-sale transactions over the last 30 days.
Ratio of transactions in specific merchant category codes over the last 1 day.
Count of card transactions during nighttime hours over the last 90 days.
Days since the customer’s last merchant-initiated transaction.
Count of secure card transactions (e.g., 3D Secure) in the last 12 hours.
Normalized transaction amount for the card over the last 30 days.

Calculates the total monetary value of all cnp_flag=True transactions (online credit card purchases) and high-value current account transfers (inferred as Faster Payments, i.e., high transaction_amt transactions not typical for debit card purchases, possibly indicated by specific MCCs for money transfers or P2P services) occurring within a very short rolling time window (e.g., 15 minutes to 1 hour). This aggregates fraud attempts across different account types and payment rails.

Calculates the number of days since the last credit card (primary or replacement) was issued to the customer. A very low value (e.g., 0-7 days) indicates a recent card issuance, which can be an anomaly if the customer rarely requests new cards, or if it's a second request in an unusually short period.
